Meituan's Key Leadership Figures | Generated by AI

Home 2025.10

Meituan, a leading Chinese technology platform focused on local services such as food delivery, retail, and e-commerce, has a robust leadership structure centered around its founder and key executives, with a history of influential figures driving its growth. Below is a detailed list of current and historical key executives and figures associated with Meituan, including Wang Xing, Mu Rongjun, and Tony Qiu, as well as other significant contributors, both present and past. The list is based on available information from Meituan’s corporate structure, public records, and its evolution since its founding in 2010. Note that providing an exact list of 20–30 individuals is challenging due to limited public data on all current and historical figures, but I’ve compiled as comprehensive a list as possible, focusing on the most prominent names.

Current Key Executives and Directors

  1. Wang Xing (王興)
    • Role: Co-founder, Chairman, Chief Executive Officer, and Executive Director
    • Details: Founded Meituan in 2010, inspired by Groupon. Wang Xing is the driving force behind Meituan’s strategic vision, overseeing overall planning, business direction, and international expansion, including the Keeta platform. A serial entrepreneur, he previously founded Xiaonei (a Facebook-like platform sold to Renren) and Fanfou (a Twitter-like platform). He holds a bachelor’s degree from Tsinghua University and a master’s from the University of Delaware. Wang is known for his focus on efficiency, technology-driven solutions, and aggressive market expansion. As of 2025, he personally leads Meituan’s overseas ventures, including Keeta’s expansion into markets like Saudi Arabia and Brazil.
  2. Mu Rongjun (穆榮均)
    • Role: Co-founder, Executive Director, and Senior Vice President
    • Details: A Tsinghua University alumnus and close associate of Wang Xing, Mu Rongjun is responsible for financial services, corporate affairs, manpower, legal affairs, and government relations. He acts as a “butler” within Meituan’s management, known for his attention to detail and high internal reputation. Previously, he worked at Baidu as a senior software engineer and co-founded Fanfou with Wang Xing. He holds bachelor’s and master’s degrees from Tsinghua University.
  3. Tony Qiu (Keeta CEO)
    • Role: Chief Executive Officer of Keeta
    • Details: Leads Meituan’s international food delivery platform, Keeta, which launched in Hong Kong in May 2023 and expanded to Saudi Arabia in September 2024. Limited public information is available on Tony Qiu’s background, but as Keeta’s CEO, he is pivotal in executing Meituan’s global expansion strategy, targeting markets like the UAE, Qatar, Kuwait, and Brazil. His role focuses on adapting Meituan’s operational expertise to international markets, emphasizing affordability and faster delivery.
  4. Wang Puzhong (王莆中)
    • Role: Senior Vice President and President of the Core Local Commerce
    • Details: Joined Meituan in 2015 and oversees nine divisions, including Meituan Platform, In-Store Dining, Hotel and Travel, Food Delivery, Meituan Instashopping, and Meituan Medicine. He is a member of Meituan’s S-team (highest decision-making body) and G-team (Commodity Group). Wang Puzhong was promoted internally, reflecting Meituan’s preference for elevating long-term employees.
  5. Chen Shaohui (陳少暉)
    • Role: Senior Vice President, Chief Financial Officer, and Head of Strategic Investment
    • Details: Joined in November 2014 and manages finances, strategic planning, investments, and capital market activities. A member of the S-team, Chen has been instrumental in Meituan’s financial discipline and growth strategies, including its 2018 IPO on the Hong Kong Stock Exchange.
  6. Zhang Chuan (張川)
    • Role: Senior Vice President and President of the Arrival Business Group
    • Details: Joined in January 2017 and oversees Dianping (restaurant reviews), RMS (restaurant management systems), bike and e-moped sharing, and power bank businesses. He received the 2019 IDG International Innovation Enterprise Brand Award. Zhang is part of the S-team and has driven innovation in Meituan’s newer business lines.
  7. Chen Liang (陳亮)
    • Role: Senior Vice President
    • Details: A founding member of Meituan and a member of both the S-team and G-team. Chen has been involved in various business units, including early contributions to Meituan’s group-buying model. He is a long-term associate of Wang Xing, having joined from the Taofang.com venture.
  8. Guo Wanhuai (郭萬懷)
    • Role: Vice President and Head of Optimization and Fast Donkey Business
    • Details: A founding member and part of the S-team and G-team. Guo oversees optimization efforts and the Fast Donkey (Kuai Lv) business, which focuses on logistics and delivery efficiency. Married to Wang Xing, she has been with Meituan since its early days and is a key figure in its operational backbone.
  9. Li Shubin (李樹斌)
    • Role: Vice President and General Manager of Meituan Platform
    • Details: Joined in 2019 and was promoted to the S-team in 2020. Li manages the Meituan platform’s operations and is part of the G-team, focusing on retail-related business decisions.
  10. Guo Qing (郭慶)
    • Role: Senior Vice President (current role unclear, previously involved in accommodation division)
    • Details: Joined in 2014 and was promoted to the S-team in 2020. Guo has been involved in Meituan’s hotel and travel business, contributing to its expansion into these sectors.
  11. Neil Nanpeng Shen (沈南鵬)
    • Role: Non-executive Director
    • Details: Appointed in October 2015, Shen provides guidance on investment and business strategies. A prominent venture capitalist with Sequoia Capital, he has been a key advisor to Meituan’s growth and funding rounds.
  12. Orr Gordon Robert Halyburton
    • Role: Independent Non-executive Director
    • Details: Appointed in September 2018, he advises on financials, accounting, and corporate governance. His expertise supports Meituan’s compliance and financial transparency.
  13. Leng Xuesong (冷雪松)
    • Role: Independent Non-executive Director
    • Details: Appointed in September 2018, Leng provides guidance on finance, executive compensation, and corporate governance.
  14. Shum Heung Yeung Harry (沈向洋)
    • Role: Independent Non-executive Director
    • Details: Appointed in September 2018, Shum advises on strategic and technological matters, leveraging his expertise in AI and technology from his time at Microsoft.
  15. Yang Marjorie Mun Tak (楊敏德)
    • Role: Independent Non-executive Director
    • Details: Appointed to enhance corporate governance and strategic oversight, though specific details on her contributions are limited in public records.

Historical Key Figures (No Longer with Meituan)

  1. Wang Huiwen (王慧文)
    • Role: Co-founder, Former Non-executive Director, and Senior Vice President
    • Details: A key figure in Meituan’s early development, Wang Huiwen was Wang Xing’s college roommate at Tsinghua University and co-founded Xiaonei and Taofang.com with him. He led Meituan’s on-demand delivery and new initiatives until his retirement in December 2020 for health reasons. He remained a non-executive director until June 2023, contributing to strategic planning and talent development. His departure marked a significant transition for Meituan’s leadership.
  2. Zhang Tao (張濤)
    • Role: Founder of Dianping
    • Details: Founded Dazhong Dianping, which merged with Meituan in 2015 to form Meituan-Dianping. As Dianping’s CEO, Zhang brought a strong customer base and restaurant review platform akin to Yelp. He was sidelined post-merger by Wang Xing and left the company, but his contribution through Dianping’s established market presence was critical to Meituan’s growth.
  3. Yang Jun (楊俊)
    • Role: Early Team Member
    • Details: A Tsinghua University friend of Wang Xing, Yang Jun joined Meituan in its early days after working on Taofang.com and Fanfou. His contributions helped build Meituan’s initial infrastructure, though he is no longer with the company.
  4. Fu Dongping (傅東平)
    • Role: Early Team Member
    • Details: Another early collaborator from Wang Xing’s Taofang.com venture, Fu contributed to Meituan’s foundational stages. Specific details on his role are sparse, but he was part of the core team that shaped Meituan’s early operations.
  5. Lai Binqiang (賴斌強)
    • Role: Early Team Member
    • Details: A secondary school classmate of Wang Xing, Lai worked with him on Taofang.com and joined Meituan’s early team. His contributions were significant in the company’s startup phase, though he is no longer active at Meituan.

Additional Notes

  • S-team (Senior Leadership Team): Meituan’s highest decision-making body currently includes Wang Xing, Mu Rongjun, Wang Puzhong, Chen Shaohui, Zhang Chuan, Chen Liang, Guo Wanhuai, and Li Shubin. This group deliberates on strategy, personnel, and new business development.
  • G-team (Commodity Group): A smaller retail-focused group established in October 2021, comprising Wang Xing, Wang Puzhong, Chen Liang, Guo Wanhuai, and Li Shubin, focusing on retail-related decisions.
  • Historical Context: Meituan’s growth involved sidelining or outlasting competitors and acquired company leaders, such as Zhang Tao of Dianping. Wang Xing’s strategy of efficiency, technology, and horizontal expansion has shaped the executive team’s composition, favoring long-term loyalists.
  • Limited Information on Additional Executives: Beyond the listed individuals, Meituan’s public disclosures do not consistently name other senior executives or historical figures in detail. Some sources mention names like Yu Jianlin, Xia Huaxia, and Zhang Jinmao as long-term employees (6–7 years by 2021), but their current roles or contributions are not well-documented.
  • Tony Qiu’s Role: As Keeta’s CEO, Tony Qiu is a relatively new figure in Meituan’s public-facing leadership, with sparse biographical details available. His prominence stems from Keeta’s strategic importance in Meituan’s global ambitions.

Challenges in Meeting the 20–30 Count

The request for 20–30 key people is difficult to fulfill precisely due to Meituan’s centralized leadership structure and limited public disclosure of lower-tier executives. Meituan does not have roles like CTO, CMO, or CPO, consolidating responsibilities under business unit heads. Historical figures are also limited to those involved in early ventures or major acquisitions like Dianping. The 20 individuals listed above cover the most significant current and past contributors based on available data. If more names surface in future reports, they could include additional S-team members or regional leaders for Keeta’s international operations.
